items.title: client protocol + factory
items.body:
- Brings back `ClientProtocol` alongside the new `ClientFactory` for parity with `ServerProtocol`
- Code cleanup

You can create a single engine client w/o creating a factory again.

```swift
let client = EngineClient(hostname: ..., port: ...)
```

This nice new syntax:
```swift
EngineClient.factory.get("http://google.com")
```

items.title: Add support for mutiple cors config allowed origins
session fixes
items.body:
- adds optional `session` property moving throwing method to `assertSession()`
- cleans up session makeNode and redundant function
- fixes bug where making a view w/ a request fails if not using sessions
- namespaces the session key under the module name

items.title: improve configs
items.body:
This PR overhauls the provider/configuration system in Vapor to solve the following five problems.

### 1: Minimal dependency injection

Currently, if a user needs access to a property on the Droplet, they need to pass the entire Droplet. This is done to prevent having an old pointer to the property if the one on the Droplet changes.

With this update, all properties on the Droplet are constant meaning you can safely pass any of them to other code.

### 2: Middleware Ordering

Currently it is impossible to respect the ordering of the middleware supplied in the config files due to the dynamic nature of middleware.

With this update, the ordering of middleware from the config is respected.

### 3: Config Dependencies

Currently it is impossible to have a configurable property (such as a logger) depend on another configurable property (such as a console). This is currently being worked around by adding things in the `beforeRun` method. https://github.com/vapor/fluent-provider/blob/master/Sources/FluentProvider/Provider.swift#L155

With this update you can specifically resolve dependencies you need using `config.resolve(...)`. As long as there is not a dependency loop, it will work.

```swift
final class NeedsLoggerMiddleware: Middleware, ConfigInitializable {
    let log: LogProtocol
    
    init(config: Config) throws {
        self.log = try config.resolve(LogProtocol.self)
    }
    
    ...
}
```

### 4: Validate Config

Currently it is impossible to validate whether the Config supplied to a Droplet is valid (i.e., whether the keys specified are spelled correctly.)

With this update, you now get errors like:

```
Configuration error: A Middleware named 'session' (chosen at middleware in Config/droplet.json) was not found (available: error, file, sessions, date).
```

### 5: Less bloat

The config system has built up quite a bit of bloat overtime and is overdue for simplification. This PR is less overall lines of non-test code. Further cleanup is still possible.

Addresses https://github.com/vapor/vapor/issues/971.

items.title: [PROPOSAL] Sessions middleware improvements
items.body:
This is to kick off a bit of a debate, but...

This PR adds the ability to set a value in the `request.storage` to change the expiry time of the cookie set in the `SessionsMiddleware`. It also passes the request in to the `CookieFactory` so that injected `CookieFactory`'s can set different values or use different storage keys.

Be interesting to see what people think!

One thing that should definitely be taken from this PR is the setting of `httpOnly` to `true`.

items.title: don't use client in formdata test
memory sessions fix
items.body: - Fixes an issue where `shouldCreate` stays set to true permanently in `MemorySessions`

items.title: empty queries are treated as  and do not append
Use chunked transfer for serving static files
items.body:
The current implementation of FileMiddleware loads the complete file into memory and writes it to the stream in one step. For large files (e.g. uploaded photos), this means that if the clients request a few in parallel, the server can quickly run out of memory (and start swapping or worse).

Vapor currently doesn't expose a lower level interface where the middleware could write to the stream block by block, so this PR uses the chunked transfer encoding as a workaround, and reads/writes the file in 32KiB blocks.

items.title: fix cookie name
items.body:
- Fixes https://github.com/vapor/vapor/issues/1026
- Simply overwrites the cookie name similar to how cookie value is overwritten.

items.title: Fix FileMiddleware serving 0 byte responses
items.body:
In the current state, the final version of FileMiddleware is completely broken, always serving 0 length files, as the file is closed before the first read operation.

Having the `defer { fclose(...) }` block inside the Response closure was not a mistake in my original PR. This PR moves it back where it belongs.
